instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan runs slow
threads.message: i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> i change the fan but it still runs slow when i check it with a fan app it says 0 rpm and when i raze it up nothing where should i look thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan runs slow
threads.message:
Did you run ASD?
Check <RESISTOR>R6060</RESISTOR>/61/65 and <TRANSISTOR>Q6060</TRANSISTOR>.
Post <CHIP>U6010</CHIP> voltages too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan runs slow
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R6065</RESISTOR> pin1 1.2v pin 2 1.16v
<RESISTOR>R6060</RESISTOR> pin1  .0v  pin 2 3.3v
<RESISTOR>R6061</RESISTOR> pin1 .85v pin 2 3.3v
<TRANSISTOR>Q6060</TRANSISTOR> pin1 1.2v pin2 3.3v
<RESISTOR>R6010</RESISTOR> pin1 3.3v pin2 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan runs slow
threads.message: Why cannot use proper signal names instead???
